title-part.text: VEHICLE PASSENGER ACCOMMODATION NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the Explanatory Note following the class title B60
In this subclass the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "cushion": seating part of a seat distinguished from the back-rest

title-part.text: Arrangement or mounting of seats in vehicles

reference.text: railway seats B61D33/00; cycle seats B62J1/00; aircraft seats B64D11/06, B64D25/04, B64D25/10

title-part.text: Arrangement or mounting of seats in vehicles

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by special measures to ensure that no seat or seat part collides, during its movement, with other seats, seat parts or the vehicle itself

title-part.text: Arrangement of seats relative to one another

CPC-specific-text.text: The seat support being a part of the vehicle body or chassis

title-part.text: Attaching seats directly to vehicle chassis

CPC-specific-text.text: with locking elements expanding inside or under the vehicle floor or rail
with the locking mechanism on the vehicle floor or rail
key rotating about a vertical axis
key sliding inside the vehicle floor or rail
locking on transversal elements on the vehicle floor or rail, e.g. transversal rods
with wheels coupled to the seat

title-part.text: the seat or part thereof being movable, e.g. adjustable

reference.text: adjustable arm-rests B60N2/75; adjustable head-rests B60N2/806

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the seat or seat part turning about or moving along a non-standard, particular axis, i.e. an axis different from the axis characterising the conventional movement
the seat or seat part turning about or moving along an inclined axis
the seat or seat part turning about or moving along a longitudinal axis
the seat or seat part turning about or moving along a transversal axis
the seat or seat part turning about or moving along a vertical axis
Non-manual adjustment, e.g. with electrical operation
characterised by details of the transmission between the electric motor and the seat or seat parts
characterised by details of the mounting of the electric motor
with relations between different adjustments, e.g. height of headrest following longitudinal position of seat
Arrangements helping the passenger to get in or out
varying hardness or support of upholstery, e.g. when driving curved roads
characterised by the type of electrical connection, e.g. wiring, plugs or USB
using sensors or detectors for adapting the seat or seat part, e.g. to the position of a passenger
using sensors or detectors for detecting the position of seat parts
reaction to emergency situations, e.g. crash
Multiple configuration seats, e.g. for spacious vehicles or mini-buses
Central command actuator to selectively switch on or engage one of several special purpose circuits or mechanisms
Longitudinal adjustment by means of articulated rods supporting the seat, e.g. parallelogram mechanisms
by linear actuators, e.g. linear screw mechanisms
Complex cross-section, e.g. obtained by extrusion
Closing members for covering the slide
Stop members for limiting sliding movement
Attachment of seat frame to the slide, e.g. eyelets
Position and orientation of the slide as a whole
the slide path being substantially in a direction different from the longitudinal
the opening of the cross section being oriented in a direction different from the vertical, e.g. transversal
with pin alignment systems, e.g. with at least one of a plurality of locking pins always aligned w.r.t. at least one of a plurality of pin-receiving elements
Activation of the latches by the control mechanism
allowing independent movement of the latches, e.g. to recover tolerance errors
the backrest being maintained in its tilted position until the seat has slided to its memorised position

title-part.text: rotatable, e.g. to permit easy access

CPC-specific-text.text: taking a position opposite to the original one
with simultaneous height and inclination adjustment

title-part.text: the front or the rear portion of the seat being adjustable, e.g. independently of each other

CPC-specific-text.text: with independent front and/or rear adjustment
pivoting about an axis located in the front
pivoting about an axis located in an intermediate position
pivoting about an axis located in the rear
pivoting about a distant axis, e.g. virtual
with a transversal pin displaced by a moving slot or a cam along a predetermined path

title-part.text: the back-rest being tiltable, e.g. to permit easy access

CPC-specific-text.text: taking a position opposite to the original one
to a position in which it can be used as a support for objects, e.g. as a tray
by longitudinal displacement of the cushion, e.g. back-rest hinged on the bottom to the cushion and linked on the top to the vehicle frame
the back-rest having two or more parts
with a transversal pin displaced by a slot or a cam along a predetermined path
provided with a lock mechanism on the upper part of the back-rest
with gears having orbital motion, e.g. sun and planet gears
in which the central axis of the gearing lies inside the periphery of an orbital gear, e.g. one gear without sun gear

title-part.text: for particular purposes or particular vehicles

CPC-specific-text.text: to support passengers in a half-standing position

title-part.text: Seats readily mountable on, and dismountable from, existing seats

CPC-specific-text.text: securing the child seat to the vehicle
with additional tether connected to the top of the child seat and passing above the top of the back-rest
securing the child to the child seat
with seat belt accessories, e.g. a belt tension detector
characterised by guiding means for children belts
having a seat and a base part
part of the base being supported by the vehicle frame
part of the base being supported by the seat sub-frame
having a front guard or barrier
adapted to carry the child, when dismounted from the vehicle
being convertible or adaptable to a preambulator, e.g. a baby-carriage or a push-chair
characterised by the peculiar orientation of the child
booster cushions, e.g. to lift a child to allow proper use of the conventional safety belts
inclinable, as a whole or partially
Upholstery, padded or cushioned members therefor
with protection systems against abnormal g-forces
Fixation to a transversal anchorage bar, e.g. isofix
the child seat being foldable, e.g. to facilitate transport

title-part.text: seats storable in a non-use position, e.g. foldable spare seats

CPC-specific-text.text: the back-rest being hinged on the cushion, e.g. "portefeuille movement"
the back-rest being hinged on the vehicle frame
the axis being located at the top of the back-rest
the cushion being hinged at the back-rest
the cushion being hinged on the vehicle frame
on a lower level of a multi-level vehicle floor
Seats convertible into parts of the seat cushion or the back-rest or disapppearing therein, e.g. for children
Disappearing in a recess of the back-rest
Disappearing in a recess of the cushion
Auxiliary rear seats accessible from outside the vehicle when in an in-use position
Dismountable seats storable in a non-use position
characterised by provisions for enhancing the cargo floor surface, e.g. elements closing gaps or enlarging the back-rest surface

title-part.text: specially constructed for use on tractors or like off-road vehicles
Seats tiltable to compensate for roll inclination of vehicles
the seat constructed to protect the occupant from the effect of abnormal g-forces, e.g. crash or safety seats

reference.text: for protecting children B60N2/26; arm-rests B60N2/75; head-rests B60N2/888

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the direction of the g-forces
due to impact coming from the front
due to impact coming from the rear
fixed structures, i.e. where neither the seat nor a part thereof are displaced during a crash
the shape of the seat being specially adapted for a particular purpose or for particular vehicles

title-part.text: Seats or parts thereof displaced during a crash

CPC-specific-text.text: involving residual deformation or fracture of the structure

reference.text: B60N2/433 takes precedence; higher part of the back-rest moving together with the headrest B60N2/888

title-part.text: Safety locks for back-rests, e.g. with locking bars activated by inertia

CPC-specific-text.text: actively controlled suspension, e.g. electronic control
attached to the base of the seat
attached to the base and the backrest
Seat guided by slides or the like
made of rubber or other material having high internal friction, e.g. polymers
Torsion springs, e.g. torsion helicoidal springs
coming from the vehicle ventilation system, e.g. air-conditioning system
with circulation of air through a layer inside the seat
with unforced air circulation, i.e. not using a fan or the like
forming a windbreak, e.g. warm air blown on the neck of the passenger of an open vehicle
by hooks, staples, clips, snap fasteners or the like
covering more than only the seat
by hooks, staples, clips, snap fasteners or the like
portable with attachment to the back-rest
having flexible support member bowed by applied forces
the back rest being mounted or joined with an easy attachment system to the seat
Particular seat belt attachment and guiding
of substantially two-dimensional shape, e.g. hammock-like, plastic shells, fabrics
Springs using a combination of metal and rubber
in a recess of the back-rest
in a recess of the cushion
Adaptations for additional use of the arm-rests
for use as electrical control means, e.g. switches

note.note-paragraph:
Group B60N2/803 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group B60N2/879.
Groups B60N2/879 and B60N2/803 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group B60N2/806 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group B60N2/879.
Groups B60N2/879 and B60N2/806 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: characterised by their adjusting mechanisms, e.g. electric motors
movable to an inoperative or stowed position
characterised by their adjusting mechanisms, e.g. electric motors
movable to an inoperative or stowed position
with means for maintaining a desired position when the seat-back is adjusted, e.g. parallelogram mechanisms
providing a fore-and-aft movement with respect to the occupant's head
providing a lateral movement parallel to the occupant's shoulder line
movable to an inoperative or stowed position
with additional features not related to head-rest positioning, e.g. heating or cooling devices or loudspeakers

note.note-paragraph:
Group B60N2/879 is impacted by reclassification into groups B60N2/803 and B60N2/806.
Groups B60N2/879, B60N2/803 and B60N2/806 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: with arrangements for protecting against abnormal g-forces, e.g. by displacement of the head-rest
with the head-rest being comma-shaped in side view
with rods solidly attached to the back-rest
with sleeves located in the back-rest for guiding the rods of the head-rest

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by structural or mechanical details not otherwise provided for

title-part.text: Details or parts not otherwise provided for

CPC-specific-text.text: the head-rest or seat used as an anchorage point, for an object not covered by groups in B60N, e.g. for a canvas

reference.text: B60N2/16, B60N2/18, B60N2/22, B60N2/225 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: the actuation of the positioning or locking mechanism for one seat part being dependent on the position of another seat part, e.g. the seats floor lock being unlocked when the back-rest is inclined or the backrest can be tilted only when the seat is in its rear position
characterised by details of the locking system
the locking system prevents an abnormal or wrong mounting situation, i.e. deployment or functioning of a seat part being prevented if the seat or seat part is not properly mounted
the locking system disabling tilting of the back-rest to the vertical position, when the seat is not properly installed
the locking system prevents tilt of whole seat by retaining and locking the seat in a vertical storage position
the locking system being an element distinct from articulation means, retaining the seat or seat part in its folded position, e.g. controlled by a wire
Warning systems, e.g. the seat or seat parts vibrates to warn the passenger when facing a danger

title-part.text: Arrangements or adaptations of other passenger fittings, not otherwise provided for

reference.text: of radio sets, television sets, telephones,
, safety belts or the like B60R

CPC-specific-text.text: of foldable trays mounted on the back-rest
with protection systems against abnormal g-forces

title-part.text: of receptacles for refuse, e.g. ash-trays
of receptacles for food or beverages, e.g. refrigerated

CPC-specific-text.text: storable or foldable in a non-use position
for receptables of different size or shape
with different elements of fixed geometry

title-part.text: of receptacles for cigarettes or the like
Arrangements or devices on vehicles for entrance or exit control of passengers, e.g. turnstiles
Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
Measures for elimination or compensation of play or backlash
Seat or seat parts characterised by comprising plural parts or pieces
Seat, bench or back-rests being split laterally in two or more parts
Dual or redundant actuating means, e.g. backrest tilting can be actuated alternatively by a lever at the backrest or a lever in the luggage compartment
Interlocking shaft arrangements transmitting movement between hinge mechanisms on both sides of a seat
